content: when finished your flower may look like a crumpled spider you ll need to give each petal a bit of a straightening tug and shape with your fingers as noted they will hold better with cotton yarn but the examples in my wreath on the last page were made with acrylic and do fine as long as they re not subjected to a lot of jostling/handling https //www ravelry com/patterns/sources/susanna-vogts-ravelry-store if you re only making an applique and the back side won t be seen you can stop here if you want to add a flat calix to the back complete the below skipping rounds 3 & 4 for a full flower and stem continue calix green yarn round 1 make a magic_ring with 6 single_crochet do not pull this completely closed if you are making a full stem you ll need to leave just enough room to insert the wooden dowel round 2 single_crochet increase around 12 st round 3 & 4 single_crochet around 12 st round 5 in flo slip_stitch in first st chain 2 picot slip_stitch in next around finishing with a slip_stitch into the first one 12 picot fasten_off leaving a long yarn end using the free back loops from round 5 of the calix and the back of the bottom row of petals sew to the underside of the bloom when there are just a couple of stitches remaining stuff calix lightly to hold shape leave room to insert the dowel then close it up lose any yarn ends inside sew calix to back of flower stuff lightly before closing https //www ravelry com/patterns/sources/susanna-vogts-ravelry-store ~ 3 ~ daisy crochet pattern by susanna leaf i am lazy and dislike using wire so i just glue the base of the leaf to the stems and let them stand or fall how they will if you want to you can crochet around a wire to hold and shape the leaves or if you re only making the flower bloom and not the stem as in for display in another form like my wreath shown on the final page you can arrange the leaves behind or around the flowers or just leave them off entirely i don t love using cotton for the leaves because my stitches come out a bit too open but that s another option to have stiffer leaves chain 10 https //www ravelry com/patterns/sources/susanna-vogts-ravelry-store round 1 side 1 starting in the 2nd chain from the hook single_crochet in the next 3 chain half_double_crochet in the next 2 double_crochet in the next 2 double_crochet increase in the next 3 double_crochet in the final chain round 1 side 2 working down the other side of the starting chain double_crochet increase in the next chain double_crochet in the next 2 half_double_crochet in the next 2 single_crochet in the last 3 chain chain 1 and turn back to the first side for round 2 round 2 side 1 slip_stitch in the first single_crochet single_crochet in the next 2 st
